trans-unit.source: This code will expire in 15 minutes.
trans-unit.target: This code will expire in 15 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Please enter the desired tenant number.
trans-unit.target: Please enter the desired tenant number.

trans-unit.source: Enter {0} to login with a new account
trans-unit.target: Enter {0} to login with a new account
trans-unit.note: {0} will be replaced with the resource from AzureUserEntry_NewLogin; it is intended to be a single-character shorthand for "new account"

trans-unit.source: Enter {0} to remove the above saved connection settings.
trans-unit.target: Enter {0} to remove the above saved connection settings.
trans-unit.note: {0} will be replaced with the resource from AzureUserEntry_RemoveStored; it is intended to be a single-character shorthand for "remove stored"

trans-unit.source: Please enter a valid number to access the stored connection settings, {0} to log in with a new account, or {1} to remove the saved connection settings.
trans-unit.target: Please enter a valid number to access the stored connection settings, {0} to log in with a new account, or {1} to remove the saved connection settings.
trans-unit.note: {0} will be replaced with the resource from AzureUserEntry_NewLogin, and {1} will be replaced with AzureUserEntry_RemoveStored. This is an error message, used after AzureNewLogin/AzureRemoveStored if the user enters an invalid value.

trans-unit.source: Number out of bounds. Please enter a valid number.
trans-unit.target: Number out of bounds. Please enter a valid number.

trans-unit.source: You have not set up your cloud shell account yet. Please go to https://shell.azure.com to set it up.
trans-unit.target: You have not set up your cloud shell account yet. Please go to https://shell.azure.com to set it up.
trans-unit.note: {Locked="https://shell.azure.com"} This URL should not be localized. Everything else should.

trans-unit.source: Do you want to save these connection settings for future logins? [{0}/{1}]
trans-unit.target: Do you want to save these connection settings for future logins? [{0}/{1}]
trans-unit.note: {0} and {1} will be replaced with AzureUserEntry_Yes and AzureUserEntry_No. They are single-character shorthands for "yes" and "no" in this language.
{0} and {1} will be replaced with AzureUserEntry_Yes and AzureUserEntry_No. This resource will be used as an error response after AzureStorePrompt.

trans-unit.source: Requesting a terminal (this might take a while)...
trans-unit.target: Requesting a terminal (this might take a while)...

trans-unit.source: Your connection settings have been saved for future logins.
trans-unit.target: Your connection settings have been saved for future logins.

trans-unit.source: Authentication parameters changed. You'll need to log in again.
trans-unit.target: Authentication parameters changed. You'll need to log in again.

trans-unit.note: {0} is the tenant's number, which the user will enter to connect to the tenant. {1} is the tenant's display name, which will be meaningful for the user. {2} is the tenant's internal ID number.
This is shorthand for "new login". The user must enter this character to activate the New Login feature (AzureInvalidAccessInput, AzureNewLogin)
This is shorthand for "remove saved connections". The user must enter this character to activate the Remove Saved Logins feature (AzureRemoveStored, AzureInvalidAccessInput)
This is shorthand for "yes". The user must enter this character to CONFIRM a prompt.
This is shorthand for "no". The user must enter this character to DECLINE a prompt.
The first argument {0} is the error code of the process. When there is no error, the number ZERO will be displayed.

trans-unit.source: You can now close this terminal with Ctrl+D, or press Enter to restart.
trans-unit.target: You can now close this terminal with Ctrl+D, or press Enter to restart.
trans-unit.note: "Ctrl+D" and "Enter" represent keys the user will press (control+D and Enter).
The first argument {0} is the error code. The second argument {1} is the user-specified path to a program. If this string is broken to multiple lines, it will not be displayed properly.
The first argument {0} is a path to a directory on the filesystem, as provided by the user.
